title.narrative: Emerging Infectious Diseases Prevention, Preparedness and Response Project

description.narrative: The objective of the Emerging Infectious Diseases Prevention, Preparedness and Response Project for China is to strengthen selected national and provincial systems to pilot a multi-sectoral approach for reducing the risk of zoonotic and other emerging health threats. The Project has four components. 1. Improving risk-based surveillance systems for zoonotic and other emerging health threats component aims at identifying the signs of infectious diseases as well as priority health threats such as Anti-microbial resistance (AMR) in a timely and cost-effective manner. 2. Prevention and control programs targeting priority zoonotic and other emerging health threats component will support the implementation of selected national or provincial programs aimed at reducing health risks at source. 3. Institutional strengthening and human resources development consistent with One Health component will provide technical assistance and training to strengthen prevention and preparedness systems, extend targeted support to inform specific policies and guidelines, and facilitate coordination and joint approaches to EIDs. The project will support the following: 3.1. Institutional Strengthening - (i) Generate evidence to facilitate the development or revision of policies, plans, notices and guidelines related to emerging health threats including infectious disease prevention and control, animal disease, and human exposure to (high-risk) animals and wildlife. (ii) Technical assistance will be provided for piloting multi-sectoral governance and regulatory systems to support One Health implementation. (iii) Institutional assessments to identify prevention, preparedness and response gaps, to strengthen the system of Center for Disease Control (CDCs) and animal disease control centers. (iv) Strengthen the animal and wildlife systems and make connections with human health sector by facilitating

title.narrative: Multi-agency monitoring of zoonoses and other emerging health threats is established, and is generating and communicating information for action in project-supported provinces
Counties achieving a reduction in the prevalence of selected zoonotic diseases or other health threats as a result of project-supported activities
Multi-Sectoral Plans prepared and implemented under the project and achieving their performance targets
Policies, guidelines, notices, and other relevant government strategy documents revised incorporating One Health approaches conforming to global and regional good practices

baseline.value: Existing policies, regulations, notices and other strategy documents related to human health, animal health and wildlife health donot sufficiently include a One Health approach in project provinces

target.value: At least 6 policies, guidelines, notices or other relevant government strategy documents have been revised and issued.

actual.value: Existing policies, regulations, notices and other strategy documents related to human health, animal health and wildlife health donot sufficiently include a One Health approach in project provinces

title.narrative: CDC, veterinary and food safety laboratories supported by the project networked and strengthened for accreditation to relevant national or international standards
Grievances registered and addressed related to the delivery of project benefits
Wet markets piloting ‘healthy marketplaces practices supported by the project
Staff trained by the project in joint field epidemiological programs under a One Health approach
Guidelines reflecting One Health approaches for cross-border inspection and quarantine systems for animal and plant products in Hainan developed and implemented
Wildlife epidemic disease monitoring stations strengthened by the project and accredited to national standards
Public communication campaigns to increase public awareness about the risk of human exposure to wildlife in project provinces or counties
Of which at the central level
Of which from the national network
Cross-sectoral management mechanism for One Health established in Hainan and meeting regularly
Of which from the provincial and sub-provincial network
Quality of surveillance system improved in selected project counties

target.value: The divergence between the surveillance system and the independent serological surveys in selected project counties has reduced.The final target percentage will be determined after the first year of project implementation.
